oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bethel Baptist Church: article on Rev. Fred Shuttlesworth
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cincinnati Post
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 3233, 3232, and 3236 29th Ave North, Birmingham, Jefferson County, AL
Online article print out of an article on Rev. Fred Shuttlesworth

Located in a black working class neighborhood, near coal mines and industrial plants, Bethel Baptist Church provided the leadership to sustain the fight for civil rights in Birminham. The church served as headquarters and frequent meeting place for the Alabama Christian Movement for Human Rights, which Rev. Fred Less Shuttlesworth founded in 1956. The church structure was built in 1926.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Shuttlesworth, Fred L., 1922-2011
